value.title: Meta-backed Hupo finds growth after pivot to AI sales coaching from mental wellness
value.content: Hupo, backed by Meta, pivoted from mental wellness to AI sales coaching for banks and insurers, and secured a $10M Series A led by DST Global

value.title: Hands-on with Bee, Amazon’s latest AI wearable
value.content: We tried Amazon's new AI wearable Bee. It's not for pro users yet, but more features are expected this year.

value.title: Why Amazon bought Bee, an AI wearable
value.content: Amazon explains where its wearable Bee fits in and whether it will merge with Alexa.

value.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta is launching its own AI infrastructure initiative
value.content: Meta is ramping up its efforts to build out its AI capacity — Zuckerberg said the company intended to drastically expand its energy footprint in the coming years.

value.title: Anthropic announces Claude for Healthcare following OpenAI’s ChatGPT Health reveal
value.content: Anthropic's Claude for Healthcare is unveiled about a week after OpenAI announced its ChatGPT Health product.

value.title: Anthropic’s new Cowork tool offers Claude Code without the code
value.content: Built into the Claude Desktop app, Cowork lets users designate a specific folder where Claude can read or modify files, with further instructions given through the standard chat interface.

value.title: Amazon says 97% of its devices can support Alexa+
value.content: Amazon is counting on its Alexa footprint to help it gain traction in the consumer AI race.

value.title: Google’s Gemini to power Apple’s AI features like Siri
value.content: Apple and Google have embarked on a non-exclusive, multi-year partnership that will involve Apple using Gemini models and Google cloud technology for future foundational models.

value.title: A New Jersey lawsuit shows how hard it is to fight deepfake porn
value.content: A number of US laws have already banned deepfake pornography — most notably the Take It Down Act. But while specific users are clearly breaking those laws, it’s much harder to hold the entire platform accountable.

value.title: Harmattan AI raises $200M Series B led by Dassault Aviation, becomes defense unicorn
value.content: French defense tech company Harmattan AI is now valued at $1.4 billion after raising a $200 million Series B round led by Dassault Aviation, which is best known for making the Rafale fighter jet.

value.title: Motional puts AI at center of robotaxi reboot as it targets 2026 for driverless service
value.content: Motional says it will launch a driverless robotaxi service in Las Vegas before the end of 2026.

value.title: Google removes AI Overviews for certain medical queries
value.content: This follows an investigation by The Guardian that found Google AI Overviews offering misleading information in response to some health-related queries.

value.title: Indonesia and Malaysia block Grok over nonconsensual, sexualized deepfakes
value.content: These are the most aggressive moves so far from government officials responding to a flood of sexualized, AI-generated imagery — often depicting real women and minors, and sometimes depicting violence — posted by Grok.

value.title: Google announces a new protocol to facilitate commerce using AI agents
value.content: Google said that merchants can now offer discounts to users directly in AI mode results.

value.title: OpenAI is reportedly asking contractors to upload real work from past jobs
value.content: An intellectual property lawyer says OpenAI is "putting itself at great risk" with this approach.

value.title: CES 2026: Everything revealed, from Nvidia’s debuts to AMD’s new chips to Razer’s AI oddities
value.content: CES 2026 is in full swing in Las Vegas, with the show floor open to the public after a packed couple of days occupied by press conferences from the likes of Nvidia, Sony, and AMD and previews from Sunday’s Unveiled event.

value.title: How the Sleepbuds maker, Ozlo, is building a platform for sleep data
value.content: Ozlo Sleepbuds are going to have a big year, with new products, AI features, and more.

value.title: CES 2026 was all about ‘physical AI’ and robots, robots, robots
value.content: After years of chatbots and image generators, AI is finally leaving the screen. At CES 2026, that shift became impossible to ignore.  The annual tech showcase in Las Vegas was dominated by “physical AI” and robotics, from Boston Dynamic’s newly redesigned Atlas humanoid robot to AI-powered ice makers (yes, really). The companies in attendance clearly want consumers […]

value.title: CES 2026: Follow live for the best, weirdest, most interesting tech as this robot and AI-heavy event wraps up
value.content: CES 2026, the annual consumer tech conference held in Las Vegas, is here. And lucky for you, we have TechCrunch editors and reporters on the ground to cover the news, scout out the interesting, weird, and relevant (and some not so relevant) tech, and of course the people working on it. AI has been at the center of most of the action, whether it's Nvidia and AMD's announcements or Amazon and Google's push for its use in the physical world. Follow our live updates as we share all the reveals and new hardware as it happens.

value.title: Meta signs deals with three nuclear companies for 6-plus GW of power
value.content: Two smaller companies, Oklo and TerraPower, along with Vistra, a large energy company, just signed agreements with Meta.
